result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert T Bagwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription, and taken only as prescribed. 

No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.
Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two as allowed by agent due to disability.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample, if not already provided. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert T Bagwell

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:24 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to DELETE repeater enhancer on Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.

State moves to DRI Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT GRANTS. 

PLEA:  Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation. 
CONDITIONS:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two as allowed by agent due to disability.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  AODA and follow up.  30 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  COURT grants 1 day credit if revoked. 

Adj:  10:36 a.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert T Bagwell
Current: 322 N 8th Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2022)
Prior: 113 S Second Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401 United States
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 03:10 pm.
Calendar call on July 6, 2022 at 08:05 am.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Case called:  9:24 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears in person with Atty Dave Casey.  
Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 

Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >> NOT GUILTY. 

Next Hearing >> Calendar call 7/06/22 at 8:05 a.m. to set further dates. 
Adj:  9:26 a.m. 

cc: Branch 4.
